Name: International Cricket 2010
Overview:
International Cricket 2010 is the sequel to Ashes Cricket 2009. It introduces a range of new features to the genre: "Action Cam" allows players to experience cricket from a 3rd-person perspective. Batsmen can look around the field to aim, tap their bat to get ready, and decide where to look when running between wickets. Bowlers can use real bowling tactics against the AI to force the error. "Power Stick" allows batsmen to specify 360 degree power and control over shot placement.

Also featured are the unlicensed versions of the four major limited overs tournaments: The World Cup (World Trophy), The Champions Trophy (Champions Cup), World Twenty20 (World 20 Overs) and IPL (20 Overs Super League). The game is licensed by the ECB and Cricket Australia, and contains commentary by David Lloyd.
